item.title: VE Day: UK marking 75th anniversary of end of WWII in Europe
item.description: The Royal Family will lead the events commemorating the end of World War Two in Europe.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: Public urged to obey rules over bank holiday
item.description: It comes after the Welsh and Scottish governments accused No 10 of sending "mixed messages".

item.title: Coronavirus: Rail services to be increased as travel restrictions ease
item.description: Train operators and the government are planning to increase rail services from mid-May onwards.

item.title: Coronavirus: Russian hospital staff 'working without masks'
item.description: As coronavirus spreads in the provinces, more and more health workers are getting sick - and dying.

item.title: Coronavirus: Public urged to continue with lockdown, train services to increase
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus outbreak this morning.

item.title: UK 'must prioritise green economic recovery'
item.description: Boris Johnson needs to prioritise the environment as the UK recovers from coronavirus, firms say.

item.title: Tara Reade: Biden sex attack accuser urges him to quit race
item.description: Tara Reade offers to take a lie detector test about her claim, on condition Mr Biden do so also.

item.title: VE Day: Berlin marks end of WW2 with unprecedented holiday
item.description: It is a one-off holiday German capital, but some think it should be marked nationally each year.

item.title: Call for credit card freeze on porn sites
item.description: Ten leading bodies say porn sites stream content featuring child sexual abuse and sex trafficking.

item.title: VE Day 2020: Last Nazi message intercepted by Bletchley Park revealed
item.description: Released to mark VE Day 75 years on, the message reports British troops entering a Nazi stronghold.

item.title: Ty: Mercury-nominated UK rapper dies of coronavirus, aged 47
item.description: The Mercury-nominated rapper had been put in an induced coma in April.

item.title: More people are driving despite the lockdown restrictions, says RAC
item.description: The motoring group's figures show that the number of vehicles on the road has climbed 11% since lockdown started.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: 'Hope' on VE Day and lockdown latest
item.description: Many papers mark Victory in Europe Day on the front pages, as the UK prepares to mark it in lockdown.

item.title: Supermoon lights up night skies around the world
item.description: Known as the Flower Moon, this is the last of three supermoons to take place during this year.

item.title: Coronavirus: UK claps for carers for the seventh week
item.description: Watch for bagpipes, Boris Johnson and bus drivers showing off their parking skills.

item.title: Coronavirus in Tottenham: 'I'm just giving all of myself'
item.description: As coronavirus spread, a group of volunteers came together to transform the lives the people around them.

item.title: Coronavirus: Fairgrounds packed up with nowhere to go
item.description: Britain's showmen are facing financial ruin as lockdown means fairgrounds rusting away in storage.

item.title: Quiz of the Week: What's in a (baby) name for Elon Musk?
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: Coronavirus: How they tried to curb Spanish flu pandemic in 1918
item.description: Face masks, fresh air and porridge - how people tried to curb a deadly flu pandemic in 1918.

item.title: Coronavirus: Five natural beauties to see on your daily exercise
item.description: With the lockdown prompting people to change their habits, many may be taking more notice of nature.

item.title: VE Day 2020: England prepares for lockdown celebrations
item.description: How are communities in England preparing to celebrate VE Day in lockdown?

item.title: Serkis: ‘Hobbit reading will take you on an adventure’
item.description: Gollum actor Andy Serkis is doing a continuous live reading of The Hobbit for charity.

item.title: Coronavirus: Lockdown lives behind each door
item.description: With the UK in its seventh week of lockdown, how different have people's experiences been?

item.title: Coronavirus: Duchess of Cambridge launches portraits photo project
item.description: The Duchess of Cambridge hopes Hold Still will show "what everyone is going through at this time".

item.title: Axl Rose and Steven Mnuchin in coronavirus Twitter spat
item.description: Guns n' Roses singer Axl Rose insulted Mnuchin over the government's handling of the pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why do I need to be tested?
item.description: BBC Reality Check breaks down what coronavirus testing is and why it matters.

item.title: Coronavirus: All dressed up and nowhere to go
item.description: Photographer Robin Sinha asked his neighbours in Walthamstow, London, to pose on their doorsteps.

item.title: VE Day choir sings online to entertain Worcestershire pensioners
item.description: Joan and Don, both in isolation, share their VE Day memories as an online choir entertains them.

item.title: How the Covid-19 pandemic is threatening Africa’s wildlife
item.description: Park rangers in Africa say the closure of safari tourism is leading to an increase in poaching.

item.title: Coronavirus: Does obesity increase the risk?
item.description: Could the amount of fat in our body increase complications with Covid-19?

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Will we have to stay in isolation for a year?'
item.description: Some people with serious illnesses are bracing themselves for a longer, tougher period of lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: Seed sales soar as more of us become budding gardeners
item.description: The lockdown has led to huge growth in the number of people buying garden seeds.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'What we've learned from lockdown job changes'
item.description: The stay at home rules have forced thousands of people to change career overnight - here's advice from three people affected.

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why did the UK need 100,000 tests a day?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus bailouts: Which country has the most generous deal?
item.description: A look at the different ways nations are trying to cushion the blow from the virus shutdowns.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown sends solo sailor on Pacific odyssey
item.description: One man's dream sailing trip nearly ended in disaster as island nations began closing their borders.

item.title: India coronavirus: Why celebrating Covid-19 'success models' is dangerous
item.description: Experts tell the BBC that euphoria over success models runs the risk of people becoming complacent.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: Would you report people who break the rules?
item.description: A hotline in New York was mocked for encouraging "snitches" but in Singapore citizen police are out.

item.title: Coronavirus: Will we ever shake hands again?
item.description: Will Covid-19 make handshakes a relic of the past? If so, what might that mean about the future of human touch and interaction?

item.title: Coronavirus contact-tracing: World split between two types of app
item.description: The UK is testing its own design but a Google-Apple initiative is winning over many other nations.

item.title: Coronavirus: Lockdown bites poor as France eases grip
item.description: France is eyeing a lifting of strict coronavirus measures on Monday but for many the damage is done.

item.title: Why 2020 'is a write-off' for gigs and festivals
item.description: A top virologist, bioethicist, and music boss on the impact of Covid-19 on hosting big events.

item.title: Coronavirus: Will offices be safe for a return to work?
item.description: Here's a look at some of the technology that might help monitor the health of employees.

item.title: Coronavirus: The health advice that is misleading or worse
item.description: There's still plenty of dangerous and untested medical advice circulating online.

item.title: Coronavirus: Texas banned abortions - how did that affect women?
item.description: In Texas, abortions are resuming as virus restrictions ease - but for many, the damage has been done.

item.title: Clubs discuss variety of kick-off times and free-to-air options
item.description: Premier League clubs discuss increasing the variety of kick-off times and the option of free-to-air games if the season resumes.

item.title: Saracens players apologise for lockdown breach
item.description: Saracens say they are disappointed with a group of players spotted breaking government rules on social distancing.

item.title: F1 may not race in 2020, say bosses, as sport reports losses
item.description: Formula 1 chairman Chase Carey has admitted that the sport's owners are preparing for "the remote possibility of no racing in 2020".

item.title: Three Fiorentina players test positive for coronavirus
item.description: Three Fiorentina players and three members of the club's support staff test positive for coronavirus.

item.title: Evander Holyfield to make ring return as Mike Tyson eyes same move
item.description: As two heavyweight legends look set to box in charity bouts, could we see one final contest between Evander Holyfield and Mike Tyson?

item.title: Newcastle will pay £70m for Coutinho - gossip
item.description: Newcastle will spend big on Coutinho and Koulibaly, Arsenal open to Icardi and Aubameyang swap, plus more.

item.title: VE Day 2020: How is it being celebrated this year?
item.description: Coronavirus means people are marking the 75th anniversary of VE Day from their own homes.

item.title: VE Day: People celebrate with bunting and bonfires
item.description: People celebrate VE Day across Britain, following Germany's surrender in 1945.

item.title: VE Day: The story behind Vera Lynn's We'll Meet Again
item.description: The song encapsulated the sadness and determination felt by families separated during WW2.

item.title: How the BBC reported VE Day
item.description: Allan Little examines how events on VE Day were reported by the BBC, and how Britain changed.

item.title: VE Day: Couple sent hundreds of love letters during WW2
item.description: Joe and Audrey were apart on VE Day but had sent hundreds of letters to each other during the war.

item.title: The enemy soldiers left in Britain after VE Day
item.description: Half a million troops came to Britain as prisoners, but what happened to them after the war ended?

item.title: VE Day: The experience of a Caribbean WW2 RAF veteran
item.description: Albert Jarrett was among some 10,000 West Indians who crossed the Atlantic to join the war effort.

item.title: The FBI said I was my parents' stolen baby - but I found the truth
item.description: Foundling Paul Fronczak was given to a family whose baby had been stolen - but was he really their son?
